communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning and/or describing Joseph "Joe" Paolino Sr. (Born 1929; died September 12, 2012). He was one of the largest developers and real estate moguls in Rhode Island, and his death was covered in the press:

https://wrnipoliticsblog.wordpress.com/2012/09/12/r-i-p-joseph-r-paolino-sr-providence-real-estate-legend/

https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/providence/name/joseph-paolino-obituary?id=15527840

Paolino Sr. should not be confused with Joseph "Joe" Paolino Jr., who was a one-time mayor of Providence, and continues to run his father's company, Paolino Properties, today.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Henry Haller - NARA (National Archives and Records Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records, specifically those unreleased, mentioning or describing Henry Haller (January 10, 1923 – November 7, 2020), a chef for five US presidents in the White House. His death was widely covered in the press:

https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/18/us/politics/henry-haller-dead.html

https://www.whitehousehistory.org/photos/fotoware?id=ADFEC450E3344320%209F25881E808D3C19

I requested such records first from the FBI, and the agency referred me to the National Archives. They also said to use file number 161-HQ-4330 for reference.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Henry Haller - NARA (National Archives And Records Administration – Archival Or Special Access)
